author: racytech
content: Yeah, from EOF. I am confused with the `container_section` inside of EOF container that could be accessed by CREATE3 only.

author: rodiazet
content: Can you elaborate please a little more why itâ€™s confusing?

author: racytech
content: This looks very simple after I figured it out, but let me make sure I got it right. 1. In the EOF header we have optional `[kind_container, num_container_sections, container_size+]`. Before I didn't know when those fields are present and when they are not, we can tell that by reading the first byte of the next section. 2. Sub-containers obviously are the same EOF containers. (shame on me)
